intro: Baryxylum rufum, commonly known as the red baryxylum, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink, often blooming in late spring. Baryxylum rufum is adapted to survive in dry, sandy soils and can thrive in harsh environmental conditions. It is also valued for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional medicine.
